get.summary: Use this module to retrieve a count and list of publications referenced in a given publication.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Publication identifier. It is returned as id element by the search module. Insert publication identifier into your URL along with the publication source, like the following example: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/MED/29867326/references

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source is a three letter code representing one of the data sources. It is returned as the source element by the search module. Further information on Europe PMC data sources can be found on the help page or in section 3 of the Reference Guide.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify the section of the references list you wish to retrieve, where applicable. Page numbers start at 1; default value is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specify the number of references you wish to retrieve in each page. The default value is 25 when the parameter is not used. The maximum allowable number of results per page is 1000.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. It can be either XML, JSON.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Use the callback parameter to make cross-domain requests and retrieve JSON data. The value is user specified. The web service wraps its response with the given callback value. Format value must be JSON.

get.summary: Use this module to retrieve supplementary files where we have these for our full text. The files will automatically download in zip format. Note that all supplementary files can be retrieved with the exception of non-Open Access images.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: All full text publications have external IDs starting 'PMC___', as with the following examples: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/PMC3258128/supplementaryFiles.

parameters.name: includeInlineImage
parameters.description: With this optional parameter all inline images can be excluded from the ZIP file. The default value is true.

post.summary: Use this module to search our publication database. For more information on query syntax, search field combination and other curiosities, see the Europe PMC help page
post.description:
This module must be used with the header Content-type:application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
This means that all the parameters must be passed in the request body in the url encoded form. Construct your POST search requests as follows:

POST https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/searchPOST with request body query=cancer&resultType=core&pageSize=10

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
User query. Possible options are:

- a keyword or combination of keywords (e.g. HPV virus).
- a phrase with enclosing speech marks (e.g. "human malaria").
- a fielded search (e.g. auth:stoehr).
Available search fields are listed in the Appendix 1 of the Reference Guide or can be retrieved using the fields module of the API.
- a specific publication (e.g. ext_id:781840 src:med).
Specify ext_id as the article identifier, and src as the source database. List of the data sources can be found on the help pages or in section 3 of the Reference Guide.

parameters.name: resultType
parameters.description:
Response Type. This parameter determines the fields returned by XML and JSON formats, but it has no effect on the DC format. It can have the following values:
  • idlist: returns a list of IDs and sources for the given search terms
  • lite: returns key metadata for the given search terms
  • core: returns full metadata for a given publication ID; including abstract, full text links, and MeSH terms

parameters.name: synonym
parameters.description: Synonym searches are not made by default (default value = 'false'), however queries can be expanded using MeSH terminology. For example aspirin, a synonym would be acetylsalicylic acid; this could be included in the search by setting the parameter value to 'true'. The parameter value is case insensitive

parameters.name: cursorMark
parameters.description: Specify the cursorMark for pagination of the result list. For the first request you can omit the parameter or leave the cursorMark empty or use the default value * (asterisk sign). For every following page use the value of the returned nextCursorMark element.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specify the number of articles you wish to retrieve in each page. The default value is 25 when the parameter is not used. The maximum allowable number of results per page is 1000.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The default sort order is relevance.
Specify the sort field and sort order. This parameter provides "asc" or "desc" order for every single-valued field: P_PDATE_D, AUTH_FIRST, CITED etc. For example sorting by CITED in ascending order: CITED asc

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. It can be either XML, JSON or DC (Dublin Core). See details here.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Use the callback parameter to make cross-domain requests and retrieve JSON data. The value is user specified. The web service wraps its response with the given callback value. Format value must be JSON.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This optional parameter registers the user's email address with EBI. The user can then be contacted about Web Service related news.

get.summary: Use this module to retrieve a count and list of biological database records that have cited a given publication (cross references).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Publication identifier. It is returned as id element by the search module. Insert publication identifier into your URL along with the publication source, like the following example: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/MED/30067176/databaseLinks

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source is a three letter code representing one of the data sources. It is returned as the source element by the search module. Further information on Europe PMC data sources can be found on the help page or in section 3 of the Reference Guide.

parameters.name: database
parameters.description:
Specify the database you wish to retrieve links for. The default is to return links for all databases. It can be one of the values from the following list:
  • ARXPR is a database of functional genomics experiments
  • ChEBI is a database and ontology of chemical entities of biological interest
  • ChEMBL is a database of bioactive drug-like small molecules
  • EMBL (now ENA) provides a comprehensive record of the world's nucleotide sequencing information
  • IntAct provides a freely available, open source database system and analysis tools for molecular interaction data
  • InterPro provides functional analysis of proteins by classifying them into families and predicting domains and important sites
  • OMIM is a comprehensive and authoritative compendium of human genes and genetic phenotypes
  • PDB (or PDBe) is the European resource for the collection, organisation and dissemination of data on biological macromolecular structures
  • PRIDE (PRoteomics IDEntifications) database is a centralized, standards compliant, public data repository for proteomics data, including protein and peptide identifications, post-translational modifications and supporting spectral evidence
  • UniProt provides a comprehensive and freely accessible resource of protein sequence and functional information

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Specify the section of the database links list you wish to retrieve, where applicable. Page numbers start at 1; default value is 1.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: Specify the number of database links you wish to retrieve in each page. The default value is 25 when the parameter is not used. The maximum allowable number of results per page is 1000.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. It can be either XML, JSON.

parameters.description: Use the callback parameter to make cross-domain requests and retrieve JSON data. The value is user specified. The web service wraps its response with the given callback value. Format value must be JSON.

get.summary: Use this module to retrieve book XML formatted full text for the Open Access subset of the Europe PMC bookshelf.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: This method will return book XML that corresponds to either the book's metadata PubMed ID (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/10510270/bookXML), or the Europe PMC 'NBK' (https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/NBK32884/bookXML). Note that only Open Access XML can be retrieved. Also note that the PMID and NBK identifiers are displayed on the Europe PMC front-end in a search results list

get.summary: Use this module to retrieve data-literature links of the API modules databaseLinks, labsLinks and textMinedTerms consolidated in one web service module and returns them in Scholix format.
get.description: Details about the Scholix format can be found here

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Publication identifier. It is returned as id element by the search module. Insert publication identifier into your URL along with the publication source, like the following example: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/MED/30067176/datalinks

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The source is a three letter code representing one of the data sources. It is returned as the source element by the search module. Further information on Europe PMC data sources can be found on the help page or in section 3 of the Reference Guide.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Restrict the response to links of a certain category. In this context the category will always be the name of the resource hosting data linked to the publication in Europe PMC.
enum: Related Immune Epitope Information - Immune Epitope Database and Analysis Resource

parameters.name: obtainedBy
parameters.description:
Limit the response to links that were obtained through:
  • Text mined accession numbers (tm_accession)
  • Text mined terms (tm_term)
  • External links (ext_links)
  • Database links (submission)

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: Limit the response to links that were updated on or after the date given in the format DD-MM-YYYY

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description:
Limit the response to links tagged with the specific tags. When using several tags at once they are to be separated by comma. Possible values are :
  • related_data: refers to data that is built on top of other data (e.g. IntAct protein interactions).
  • supporting_data: refers to data hosted in databases that host primary data, i.e. data that is not built on top of other data (e.g. protein structures (PDBe) and nucleotide sequences (ENA)))
  • plain_english: plain english content related to the linked publication (e.g. press releases, lay summaries).
  • fulltext: datalinks to resources providing the fulltext publication.
  • other: datalinks not captured by the other tags (e.g. training courses and peer reviews)

parameters.name: sectionLimit
parameters.description: Limit the number of links returned per section. Each "obtainedBy" process of each category is an individual section

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: This optional parameter registers the user's email address with EBI. The user can then be contacted about Web Service related news.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of the response. It can be either XML or JSON.

get.summary: Use this module to obtain a 'profile' of hit counts from our database for various publication types and data sources.
get.description:
This module adheres to the CORS standard of headers to enable javascript cross-domain search.
Construct your URL for profile requests as follows:

GET https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest/profile?query=parameters

Note that for this module, the user may specify either a slash symbol (/) or a question mark symbol (?) after the method name, and before the query.For example: profile?query=parameters or profile/query=parameters

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
User query. Possible options are:

- a keyword or combination of keywords (e.g. HPV virus).

- a phrase with enclosing speech marks (e.g. "human malaria").

- a fielded search (e.g. auth:stoehr).
Available search fields are listed in the Appendix 1 of the Reference Guide or can be retrieved using the fields module of the API.

- a specific publication (e.g. ext_id:781840 src:med).
Specify ext_id as the article identifier, and src as the source database. List of the data sources can be found on the help pages or in section 3 of the Reference Guide.

parameters.name: profiletype
parameters.description:
The profile type can have one of the following values:
  • pub_type: returns a profile of various publication types.
  • source: returns a profile for the various data sources we obtain publications from.
  • all: returns a profile for all of the above (default value).
